text: I have uploaded css and js files to the Design Manager as I build out a theme. These files are assigned to modules created in Design Manager. I thought HubSpot minifies these, but am I wrong? When I view pages in content staging the files are not minified.

<@U03AKL6Q1B2> <@U25PYL3Q8>
I'm seeing some different behavior in the accounts. In the Standard Sandbox when I create a new webpage and I'm taken to the page where I have to select a theme, I can't see the theme, but there's a "Skip to templates" button where I can jump ahead to the templates. At that point I can view and select the templates from the correct theme (which is how I did it before in that account). In the devs CMS when I create a webpage and I'm taken to where I have to select a theme, I also can't see the theme, but there's no "Skip to templates" or anything so I can't create a page. I'm not sure why it would be different between those accounts.

In both accounts when I go to Settings -> Tools -> Themes and then click on the theme it tells me that the theme has no templates. It does have a lot of templates though. I'm wondering if this has anything to do with the problem with the modules.

One thing I noticed about the template files when I look at them locally. All the files in the templates directory are json files. In other themes I've used the files are all html. I think I've always created templates as HTML files. I'm wondering how these templates were created. Wasn't there a way to create a template in HubSpot so that it's non editable? I'm remembering there was "drag and drop" type or something, but I don't see it now. Was it removed?

Before moving forward I guess I should just keep messing around with these two accounts to see what I can find out or get to work.

<@U07DXTA87L6> this sounds like a super mess.

Is the theme in your original portal a child theme of a parent theme? That might be what is going on here?

If that isn’t the issue, I’m not sure what the actual issue is here! I might be able to look at it early next week if you want a second eye on it.

<@U25PYL3Q8> Yea, and it looks like a mess too. There are so many files everywhere and I'm not sure what they're for. It looks like there are a lot of old files that are not being used. There are also more than 50 GB of files in the Library->files, most of them high resolution images. Well... one step at a time. The first thing I'm supposed to do is get some kind of dev environment set up so I can test minor tweaks with out cluttering up the main account.

I think the theme is a custom theme with no parent. I've never used a child theme before in HubSpot so I'm not sure yet how they are identified, but I'll see if I can find out what it is. I'll update you here if I find out anything else and maybe we can try looking at it next week.
Thanks!

Goodday Developer group! I need some help! I am looking to display deal data to my user on a landing page which makes up a customer portal. Adding personalization tokens is very limited as they do not pull the right data if any at all. I need to pull deal data and display. I have tried creating a module yet it continuously says deal data cannot be displayed. Any one who could perhaps guide me here?
